content: mini melt ice brooch by jody-sallese mason inspiration came from life size versions of the melt ice hats and i wanted a smaller version which i could pin to my purse strap or coat lapel this one measures approximately 1 75 tall from point to cuff the cord and tassel add almost another 2 depending on the length you knit yarn any sock weight or fingering weight yarn left overs needles 37 circular needle in size 1 for magic loop or 5 double pointed needles in size 1 using long tail cast on or for tubular cast on knitting two minute guides my favorite cast on for 1x1 ribbing cast on 32 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist and place a marker at beginning of round knit 1x1 ribbing for 4 rounds knit 4 rounds of stockinette place two markers different from beginning of round marker between stitches number 8 and 9 and again between stitches number 24 and 25 begin decreases round 1 knit to 2 stitches before first marker ssk slip marker k2tog knit to next marker and repeat ssk slip marker k2tog knit to end of round round 2 knit the round alternate these two rounds until only 4 stitches remain then k2tog k2 do not turn work slide stitches to other end of needle to knit i-cord for 1 make a tiny 1 tassel and attach to end weave in ends and wear proudly if you attach it to your coat with a visible safety pin the pin is another symbol of solidarity safety and allyship with marginalized groups
